author: Sam Wallace
title: Uncomfortable new findings into the safety of new generation 3G pitches are something no parent can ignore
text:
I n Dutch football, and Dutch political life, it is the problem that simply will not go away and yesterday the issue of the safety of the new generation of 3G pitches exploded once again with fresh allegations that the government’s safety tests had overlooked crucial aspects.
The safety of rubber crumb, the shredded tyres that act as infill on the new 3G pitches, is one that no parent can ignore given the boom in construction of the past 10 years, both in Holland and now across the United Kingdom . What is in the 20,000 recycled tyres per pitch that make those little sock-filling black pellets? And can a product which by its nature is subject to so many variables be adequately monitored by regulatory bodies?
The English Football Association is embarking on the Parklife Grassroots hub project, which plans to build £200 million of 3G rubber-crumb pitches in 30 towns and cities across England. ...
